intro: Gardoquia fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered gourd, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, squash, and gourds. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that give way to green, cylindrical fruits. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are trailing and often hairy. Gardoquia fasciculata is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
